meanings.definition: Capable of being placed opposite something else.
meanings.sent1: The two magnets had opposable ends that attracted each other.
meanings.sent2: The puzzle pieces had opposable shapes that fit perfectly together.
meanings.sent3: The opposable socks kept sliding off my feet!
meanings.sent4: Her opposable ideas clashed with his traditional views.
meanings.sent5: The opposable colors of the painting created a striking contrast.

meanings.definition: Capable of being opposed or resisted.
meanings.sent1: The team's plan was opposable to any changes.
meanings.sent2: His stubbornness made him opposable to compromise.
meanings.sent3: The cat was surprisingly opposable to wearing a costume.
meanings.sent4: Her beliefs were opposable to the popular opinion.
meanings.sent5: The fortress was opposable to any enemy attacks.

meanings.definition: Capable of being placed against something else.
meanings.sent1: The book was opposable to the bookend on the shelf.
meanings.sent2: The mirror was opposable to the wall in the hallway.
meanings.sent3: The opposable door kept swinging open in the wind.
meanings.sent4: His argument was opposable to hers in the debate.
meanings.sent5: The opposable leaves of the plant provided a beautiful backdrop.
